xbeerelay
Class XbeeSWTGui

java.lang.Object
  xbeerelay.XbeeSWTGui

public class XbeeSWTGui
extends java.lang.Object

This is the main class for the PC side. It makes use of the XbeeRelayManager API which can turn on and off relays by sending commands to a remote Arduino/Xbee system.

Running main in this class launches two windows: one for relay monitoring and control, and another for plotting the current power consumption in the simulated house. This plot is updated in real time, and the remote Xbee chip is used for IO sampling. See our main report for a description of the Xbee settings that are required for this to work.

Author:
Casey Worthington

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws RelayException,
                        com.rapplogic.xbee.api.XBeeException,
                        java.io.IOException
Starts the GUI. This includes a relay-control and monitoring window, which lists the relays configured in defaultConfig.config and their current status. It also includes a graph of the current power consumption to the load.
